intro: Morinda squarrosa, commonly known as the red-rooted mignonette, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Morinda squarrosa is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
